question: people find it very difficult to speak in public or to give a presentation before an audience.do you think public speaking skill is really important?should students be taught public speaking at school?
text: As the majority of people find it challenging to talk in open spaces, it is important for them to undergo a sort of training to develop this ability. This essay will discuss the importance and usefulness of public speaking, as well as if pupils at learning institutions should partake in a form of schooling in the art of public speaking.

Depending on what career or area of work someone is a part of, the usefulness of speaking in public varies. However as a type communication it is very crucial as it can translate to success in many parts of life, due to the fact an adept speaker is much more likely to be confident in themsleves. This belief in oneself will ultimately make them a better a conversater, which in turn will improve all aspects of their relationships be them at work or personal. A research undergone in 2003 at Belfast university showed this point in a population of office workers. Results from this study found that employees who held a certificate in vocal presenting to an audience, were three times more likely to be rated as confident by their peers in a survey.

Most schools do not have a formal way of teaching public speaking, as it is not a part of the curriculum in England. ,Nevertheless it is proven that institutions which voluntarily choose to implement verbal coaching for pupils, often always see a strong correlation in speaking skills and better performance in core subjects in the syllabus. Leading to a more active school community, in addition to improved numbers of university offers for the youth.

In conclusion holding some expertise of public speaking is crucial to the modern-day person, as it brings about numerous positives to ones life in the workplace and outside of it. ,Furthermore the induction of educating children in the way of public speaking, has too yielded indisputable betterment to young people's future job and eduactional prospects. Leading to the point that it must and should be taught in schools.
